Package software.kes.kraftwerk.frequency

Interface FrequencyMap<A>

  • Type Parameters:
    A - the output type
    All Superinterfaces:
    com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functor.Functor<A,​FrequencyMap<?>>, ToGenerator<A>
    public interface FrequencyMap<A>
extends ToGenerator<A>, com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functor.Functor<A,​FrequencyMap<?>>
    A strategy for randomly choosing between one or more Generators (or values) of a specific type, with a custom set of probabilities. Before it can be converted to a Generator, a FrequencyMap must contain at least one value with a weight greater than zero.

    To build a Generator from a FrequencyMap, call toGenerator(). A FrequencyMap can always continue to be used and added to, even after calling toGenerator.

    FrequencyMaps are immutable. Any method that appears to mutate a FrequencyMap actually creates a new FrequencyMap, while leaving the original unchanged.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this FrequencyMap contains at least one element with weight greater than zero.

      • toGenerator

        Generator<A> toGenerator()
        Builds a Generator from this FrequencyMap, if it is not empty. If this FrequencyMap is empty (i.e., it contains no weights greater than zero), this method will throw an IllegalStateException.

        This FrequencyMap<A> can continue to be used after calling this method.

        Specified by:
        toGenerator in interface ToGenerator<A>
        Returns:
        a Generator<A>
        See Also:
        isEmpty()

      • combine

        FrequencyMap<A> combine​(FrequencyMap<A> other)
        Creates a new FrequencyMap that is the combination of this one and another one.

      • multiply

        FrequencyMap<A> multiply​(int positiveFactor)
        Creates a new FrequencyMap that is the same as this one, with its existing weights multiplied by positiveFactor. Useful for combining with other FrequencyMaps.
        Parameters:
        positiveFactor - number to multiply by; must be >= 1.
        Returns:
        a new FrequencyMap containing the same entries with the weights multiplied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if positiveFactor is < 1.

      • add

        default FrequencyMap<A> add​(Generator<? extends A> gen)
        Creates a new FrequencyMap that is the same as this one, with a Generator added. The added Generator will have a weight of 1.
        Parameters:
        gen - a Generator
        Returns:
        a FrequencyMap<A>

      • addValue

        default FrequencyMap<A> addValue​(A value)
        Creates a new FrequencyMap that is the same as this one, with a value added. The added value will have a weight of 1.
